structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
COUNTY EMPLOYEES' CIVIL SERVICE AND RETIREMENT

law.catch_line: Chairman, vice chairman -- Administrative regulations -- Voting, quorum.

text.section: Upon appointment and qualification of the members of the board, they shall meet within the thirty (30) days following the creation of the board and elect their chairman and vice chairman and adopt such rules and regulations and bylaws not inconsistent with KRS 78.400 to 78.480 and 78.990 for the proper conduct of their offices. In all matters requiring a vote, a majority of the board members present and voting shall determine any question, provided that at least three (3) board members be present to constitute a quorum.
In cases of discipline, four (4) members of the board must be present to constitute a quorum, one (1) of which must be a police officer as defined in subsection (3) of KRS 78.410.

law.history: Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 319, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1988. -- Amended 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 198, sec. 3. -- Created 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 141, sec. 2(5), effective March 4, 1952.
